abstract: Michiko Kakutani Critic’s Notebook applauds Pres Obama’s remarkable eulogy for Rev Clementa C Pickney, victim of racially motivated mass shooting in Charleston, SC; submits Obama's gifts of language and empathy shaped apt talk on race and justice in emotional setting.
lead_paragraph: The president’s speech at the funeral of the Rev. Clementa C. Pinckney was not just eloquent but remarkable in how it fit a mass shooting into a discussion of race and justice.

headline.main: Obama’s Eulogy, Which Found Its Place in History
headline.print_headline: A Eulogy That Found Its Place in History

snippet: The president’s speech at the funeral of the Rev. Clementa C. Pinckney was not just eloquent but remarkable in how it fit a mass shooting into a discussion of race and justice.

keywords.value: Emanuel African Methodist Episcopal Church (Charleston, SC)
